definitions: Past tense and past participle of 'shoot'.
To hit, wound, or kill with a missile discharged from a weapon.
To propel (a ball or other object) towards a goal or target.
To move suddenly and rapidly in a particular direction.
To photograph or film (a scene, person, or object).
examples: He shot the ball into the net.
They shot the movie on location.
He shot a glance at his watch.
